alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 3:34AM CDT until March 26 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Fork River at Highway EE, Boone Creek at Boone Creek Road, Rock Creek at Rock Creek Road, North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, Big Piney River at Cleveland Road and Little Piney River at Union Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Grove, Houston, Licking, Cabool, and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
